DFT calculations were performed using the Vienna ab initio software package [ 42, 43]. Interactions between valence and core electrons were modeled using the projector-augmented wave method [ 44]. The plane-basis wave expansion was analyzed using the generalized gradient approximation with the Perdew–Burke–Ernzerhof functional [ 45]. The cutoff energy was 400 eV. The Brillouin area was divided by the sampled grids of 2 × 2 × 1 gamma-centered k-points in both vertical and lateral graphene supercells with embedded M-N 4 (M = Fe, Co) structures [ 46]. A smearing width of 0.1 eV was used in the Methfessel–Paxton smearing scheme [ 42]. In the self-consistent calculation, the energy convergence domain was set to 10 −5 eV, and the geometric configuration was completely relaxed until Hellman–Feynman forces reached 0.02 eV Å −1. The binding energies of OH, O, OOH, and O 2 were calculated to determine the OER- and ORR-induced energy changes of M-N 4 (M = Fe, Co).
